meanings.definition: Do something that one considers to be beneath one's dignity.
meanings.sent1: She was deigning to pick up the trash, even though she thought it was beneath her.
meanings.sent2: He deigned to help his little sister tie her shoes, showing kindness.
meanings.sent3: The queen deigning to wash the dishes caused quite a stir in the palace.
meanings.sent4: The CEO deigning to eat lunch with the interns was a rare sight.
meanings.sent5: The cat deigning to play with a simple toy amused the children.

meanings.definition: Condescend reluctantly and with a strong sense of the affront to one's superiority that is involved.
meanings.sent1: The professor was deigning to explain the concept to the confused student.
meanings.sent2: She deigned to attend the party, but her disdain was evident.
meanings.sent3: The celebrity deigning to take a photo with a fan made the fan's day.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy heiress deigning to shop at a thrift store raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The politician deigning to listen to the concerns of the common people was a rare sight.
